definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: Many bold decisions need to be taken, and taken soon.
sentences.chinese: 需要作出许多具有胆识的决定，而且时不我待。

sentences.english: She hesitated as long as she dared.
Never forget that no military leader has ever become great without audacity .
sentences.chinese: 伟大的军事领袖无不胆识过人。

sentences.english: Generously to show him as commander in chief for the fearless courage and great spirit hung.
sentences.chinese: 慨然表现出他作为统帅的无畏胆识与雄大气魄。

sentences.english: They're very courageous. They deal with tension.
sentences.chinese: 有胆识，能够很好地应对紧张情绪。

sentences.english: Now the Swiss who made a little more distant, more confident, of the rationale for There is courage.
sentences.chinese: 如今的瑞发人更有远略，更有信心，理有胆识。

sentences.english: Your gut instinct is the best decision-making tool.
sentences.chinese: 你的直觉和胆识是你做任何决定时最好的指引。

sentences.english: Three rats are sitting at the bar bragging about their bravery and toughness.
sentences.chinese: 三只老鼠坐在酒吧里，吹嘘他们的胆识和强壮。

sentences.english: No one reaches a high position without daring.
All you needed was luck and cunning and boldness.
sentences.chinese: 所需要的只有运气，狡猾和胆识。

sentences.english: Legions of brave women wrote and lectured for change.
sentences.chinese: 众多富于胆识的女性为变革奋笔疾书，登上讲坛。

sentences.english: I admire him for his bravery and learning.
sentences.chinese: 我羡慕他胆识过人，学问渊博。

definition: to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
